intro: Silene anaglaea, commonly known as the rock pink, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or arid environments. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Silene anaglaea is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
